overview_summary: Three neighboring landowner profiles were compiled. None have a documented stance on local development – all are classified as unknown stance. All three appear to have relatively low public profiles. Only one (the Brooks family) has deep local roots (a family-named road), while the others are newer arrivals. No high-influence officials are present; all are private residents with low community influence.

neighbors.name: Della Lu Brooks, Megan Lee Brooks & Morgan Marie Brooks
neighbors.claims: The Brooks family co-owns property on Alva Brooks Lane, a road likely named after a family member, with a 3-bedroom house built in 2006 on a 1.37-acre lot [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/13328-Alva-Brooks-Ln-Spotsylvania-VA-22551/64536987_zpid/). Records show a 2-acre portion of this family’s land was sold in 2002 for about $94,700, indicating the area’s gradual parceling from a legacy holding [Trulia](https://www.trulia.com/home/13321-alva-brooks-ln-spotsylvania-va-22551-64845407)[95】. No references were found of any Brooks family members speaking in local hearings or media about development issues [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/27/hundreds-pack-into-contentious-spotsylvania-meeting-on-solar-project-supervisors-delay-decision/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member acknowledge their family’s long local history and emphasize how any project plans respect their land legacy and continuity.

neighbors.name: Anthony Gaudet & Brenda G. Gaudet
neighbors.claims: Anthony J. Gaudet (age 56) and Brenda G. Gaudet (age 55) live on a 5.28-acre residential property along Pamunkey Road in Spotsylvania [Public Records Directory](https://www.simplecontacts.com/state/VA/Spotsylvania/Pamunkey-Road)[92】. Their home is a 3-bedroom, 2-bath house built in 2000 on that acreage [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/8861-Pamunkey-Rd-Spotsylvania-VA-22551/64813243_zpid/)[85】. Public records indicate the Gaudets previously resided in Louisiana as recently as 2016 before moving to Spotsylvania [NationalPublicData](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/g/anthony-gaudet/)[82】. They have not been identified in local news or meeting minutes as speaking out on development or energy projects (no public statements located) [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/27/hundreds-pack-into-contentious-spotsylvania-meeting-on-solar-project-supervisors-delay-decision/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Gaudets one-on-one with factual information, emphasizing that their rural peace and property value will be maintained. Personal outreach respecting their desire for a quiet environment is likely to resonate.

neighbors.name: Tammy Newton Pavey
neighbors.claims: Tammy Newton Pavey owns a roughly 2-acre residential parcel on Alva Brooks Lane in Spotsylvania, with a modest 1,256 sq ft home on it [Trulia](https://www.trulia.com/home/13321-alva-brooks-ln-spotsylvania-va-22551-64845407)[93】. County records show that this property changed hands in 2002 for approximately $95,000, suggesting Ms. Pavey (or her family) established residence there around that time [Trulia](https://www.trulia.com/home/13321-alva-brooks-ln-spotsylvania-va-22551-64845407)[95】. There is no public record of Ms. Pavey taking a visible stance on local development or energy projects (no mentions of her in available news or county meeting archives) [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/27/hundreds-pack-into-contentious-spotsylvania-meeting-on-solar-project-supervisors-delay-decision/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local resident; no known public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect with Ms. Pavey through a neighborly conversation, acknowledging her long tenure in the community. Emphasize that plans will not disrupt the quiet character of the area and address any heritage or property concerns she might have.
